Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 2nd overall pick, by Pittsburgh in 1970...
Injured on 6/9/1970 with a Bruised Ankle, out for 4 days...
Had first career hit on 4/3/1971, off Jerry Nyman (PHI)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/6/1971, off Ray Culp (PHI)...
Injured on 9/17/1971 with a Inflamed Groin Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 7/1/1972 with a Pulled Abdominal Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Batter of the Month award on 9/1/1973, hitting .363 with 10 HR, 32 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/2/1973, hitting .579 with 3 HR, 12 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/26/1975, hitting .414 with 3 HR, 9 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 6/1/1975, hitting .365 with 7 HR, 24 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against St. Louis on 6/8/1975...
Was selected to the 1975 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/28/1976, hitting .429 with 1 HR, 8 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 5/1/1977, hitting .327 with 8 HR, 22 RBI...
Injured on 6/26/1977 with a Strained Abdominal Muscle, out for one week...
Was selected to the 1978 Allstar game...
Won Batter of the Month award on 8/1/1978, hitting .349 with 3 HR, 23 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against New York (N) on 5/7/1980...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/19/1980, hitting .536 with 2 HR, 5 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 6/1/1980, hitting .365 with 6 HR, 18 RBI...
Traded from Pittsburgh to New York (N) on 2/5/1981 (Going to PIT: 1B K. Hrbek, RF V. Hayes, CF G. Redus, P B. Holton. Going to NYM: LF G. Matthews Sr., RF H. Kadota, P T. Johnson)...
Injured on 6/9/1981 with a Strained Rib Cage Muscle, out for one week...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1981...
Injured on 9/13/1982 with a Pulled Back Muscle, out for one week...
Won Batter of the Month award on 8/1/1983, hitting .367 with 5 HR, 23 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/4/1983, hitting .500 with 3 HR, 10 RBI...
Had 2000th career hit on 10/2/1983, off Steve Brown (PHI)...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1983...
Drove in 6 runs against Pittsburgh on 8/3/1985...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1985...
